Rule.Name: Ensure ErrorLog and LogLevel are configured per best practices (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Error log filename and severity level are not configured per best practices.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set LogLevel to "notice core:info" and configure the ErrorLog directive appropriately.
Rule.Correction: sed -i 's/^LogLevel .*/LogLevel notice core:info/' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf; echo 'ErrorLog "logs/error_log"' >> /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf; systemctl restart httpd
Rule.Verification: grep -q "^LogLevel notice core:info" /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf && grep -q "ErrorLog" /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.Name: Ensure ErrorLog is configured to send logs to syslog (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Error logs are not being sent to a syslog facility.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure the ErrorLog directive to send logs to a syslog facility (e.g., syslog:local1).

Rule.Name: Ensure server access log is configured with proper format (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The server access log is not configured with the proper log format.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Define a proper LogFormat and configure CustomLog to log all necessary tokens.
Rule.Correction: echo 'LogFormat "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-Agent}i\"" combined' >> /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf; echo 'CustomLog "logs/access_log" combined' >> /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf; systemctl restart httpd

Rule.Name: Ensure log rotation is configured for at least 3 months (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Log rotation is not configured to retain logs for at least 3 months.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure logrotate for Apache logs to rotate weekly and retain at least 13 rotations.
Rule.Correction: echo "/var/log/httpd/*log { weekly rotate 13 missingok notifempty compress }" >> /etc/logrotate.d/httpd

Rule.Name: Ensure Apache patches are applied timely (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Apache patches are not up-to-date, leaving the server vulnerable.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Apply all available security patches within one month of release.
Rule.Correction: Manual update required; verify vendor updates and apply via the package manager or source upgrade

Rule.Name: Ensure ModSecurity is installed and enabled (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: ModSecurity is not installed or enabled, reducing web application firewall capabilities.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Install and enable ModSecurity; ensure the security2_module is loaded.
Rule.Correction: yum install mod_security -y || apt-get install libapache2-mod-security2 -y; systemctl restart httpd

Rule.Name: Ensure OWASP ModSecurity CRS is installed and enabled (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: OWASP ModSecurity Core Rule Set is not installed or enabled.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Install and configure the OWASP ModSecurity Core Rule Set per best practices.
Rule.Correction: Manual installation required; download the CRS from the OWASP website, configure it, and restart httpd
